text: Copied this directly from design manager "public URL" but on the front end it doesn't seem to work. Any ideas?
in the url field, doen´t it need to be "url ('myurl ')  like with those ' '   maybe you could switch the quotation marks to that?

Hi <@UBT0AHWLD> thanks for getting back to me.
I think the issue is `{{ get_asset_url("/ancoris-2020/assets/images/figure_point_graphic.svg") }}`  is not resolving.
However, I have tried your suggestion with still no luck. The inspect value is actually empty (even thought its displaying a random URL there when I click it, it disapears to just `url('')`

maybe `get_asset_url()`  doesn't work in cascading style sheets? (<@UG52C29EE> could this be right?)

As `background-image: url('/hubfs/raw_assets/public/ancoris-2020/assets/images/figure_point_graphic.svg');` works just fine

In regards to HubSpot performing the CSS/JS combining, this seems to be so hit or miss. When it fails, I have the hardest time combing through all the templates and modules to determine where an issue may be. I'm also unclear on what _is_ and what _isn't_ acceptable for successful combination. Is there a way to see where the CSS/JS combinator fails? To better define where an error might be?
<@U25PYL3Q8> hey man! any thoughts on this? it looks really weird to me

Hi there, I need to add CSS animation to a SVG image in a Hero module. I’m new to HubL. Where should I add the SVG image code at? Should I modify the hero HubL to give me a drag and drop option to then place the code there, or straight into the HubL? SVG’s codes are pretty long and can be heavy. Thanks in advance!
